basics.name: Johann von Tiesenhausen
basics.summary: I'm a lifelong learner who is passionate about software development, with an interest in systems programming for a range of applications. I enjoy sharing my enthusiasm by creating tutorials for peers and mentoring young learners. I love coding in my free time, learning new programming languages and codebases, and working on personal projects.

work.name: Queen's University, Ingenuity Labs Research Institute
highlights: Designed and built a custom wearable glove device for human-robot interaction
Implemented a system for controlling the excavation process of a front-end loader
Developed a novel dynamic hand gesture recognition system using Dynamic Time Warping
Ran tutorials to help incoming graduate students develop a familiarity with ROS and related tooling

work.name: Queen's University, Department of Mechanical and Materials Engineering
highlights: Ran tutorials and labs for two courses, MECH 399: Mech Eng Lab II and MECH 496: Musculoskeletal Biomechanics, over multiple semesters
Assisted students in achieving key learning outcomes through guided learning

work.name: Toronto Police Lifeguard Service
highlights: Developed leadership skills by mentoring new lifeguards
Served as a representative for the City of Toronto, engaging with the public

work.name: Camp Kandalore
highlights: Helped create a positive outdoor experience for young campers aged 10 to 16
Co-ran canoe camping trips, assisting in the planning and preparation for canoe trips including flat or white water spaddling
Helped young learners develop a passion for coding
Used Python and Lua to work on a variety of creative projects, focusing on key skills such as reading code/documentation, understanding error messages, and writing reusable code

education.area: Applied Science, Mechanical and Materials Engineering
Applied Science, Mechanical and Materials Engineering

publications.name: Hand Gesture-Based Control of a Front-End Loader
publications.summary: An overview of the designed and application of an instrumented glove to the excavation process of a Front-End Loader. A set of hand gestures were used as supervisory input to control loader states and manipulate bucket curl during digging.

projects.name: Scheme-y Programming Language
projects.description: scheme-y is an implementation of the Scheme programming language (dialect of LISP) written in C99 and adhering to a subset of R7RS (Revised Report on the Algorithmic Language Scheme).
highlights: Implementation of the Scheme programming language (dialect of LISP) written in C99 and adhering to a subset of R7RS (Revised Report on the Algorithmic Language Scheme)
Ongoing personal project to learn the fundamentals of programming language design including parsing techniques, virtual machine design, and automatic memory management.
Wrote a novel generational garbage collector using multiple heap semi-spaces for efficient copying collection based on Cheney's Algorithm

projects.name: DTW-live Scikit-Learn Plugin
highlights: dtw-live is a Python library and scikit-learn plugin for real-time segmentation and classification using Dynamic Time Warping, developed over the course of a Master's Degree
Implemented a custom classifier with serialization/deserialization functionality, dataset preprocessing, feature extraction, and visualizations
Wrote optimized C code for calculating Dynamic Time Warping cost matrices in a real-time context using SPRING-DTW
